content: basically perfect baby socks i have tried many versions of baby socks but babies tend to have chubby little feet and traditional heels tend to slip off these socks have a combination of gusset and short-row heel giving them a deeper heel and helping the socks stay on better these socks are incredibly forgiving and can be sized from newborn to about 18months by simply varying the length of the foot for an older toddler knit the cuff just a little bit taller about 2 ¼ inches or so materials 100g of fingering weight yarn gauge 7 5 sts/inch needles 2 75 mm dpns or size needed to achieve gauge cast on 32 stitches k2 p2 rib until cuff is desired height 1 5 to 2 inches is a good height for most babies begin gusset section k16 turn slip 1 p15 turn slip 1 k15 turn slip 1 p15 turn begin short row section slip 1 k 14 wrap last stitch but do not knit it turn p14 wrap last stitch turn k13 wrap turn p12 wrap turn k11 wrap turn p10 wrap turn k9 wrap turn ---- now instead of each row becoming shorter each row will be slightly longer --- p8 k2wp wrap next stitch turn k9 p2wp wrap next stitch turn p10 k2wp wrap turn k11 p2wp wrap turn p12 k2wp wrap turn k13 p2wp you have now finished the short-row section and will pick up the final wrap on the next round finish gusset section pick up and knit three stitches along the left side of the little rectangle you made at the start of the gusset section knit across instep 16 stitches pick up and knit three stitches along the right side of the little rectangle you made at the start of the gusset section k2wp k7 you are now at the center of the heel k9 k2tog k16 ssk k9 k8 k2tog k16 ssk k8 k7 k2tog k16 ssk k7 k8 place marker you have now finished the heel and the marker indicates the start of the round knit until the sock is the desired length do not include the cuff in these measurements only measure the instep length size 1 5 0-6 months 2 6-12 months 2 5 12+ months 3 18 months toe begin at the top of the instep this is where your marker should be remove marker row 1 *k1 ssk k10 k2tog k1* twice row 2 knit row 3 *k1 ssk k8 k2tog k1* twice row 4 knit row 5 *k1 ssk k6 k2tog k1* twice row 6 *k1 ssk k4 k2tog k1* twice use kitchener stitch to close the toe weave in ends make a second sock and you re done abbreviations k knit p purl k2tog knit 2 together p2tog purl 2 together ssk slip slip knit slip two stiches knitwise place back on the left hand needle and knit together ssk slip slip slip knit slip three stiches knitwise place back on the left hand
